text: our mobile phones keep us in touch with
the world but are they such a
distraction that we miss what's going on
right in front of our nose we all know
texting and driving is bad but what
about texting and walking you can miss I
don't know why like $20.00 floating over
your head normally when it comes to our
attention span the more engaged and
interactive we are the more we don't
notice things around us for example if
you're passively looking at a sunset you
can notice other things that are going
on if you're actively texting or
engaging in social media that's gonna
take much more of your attention span
than if you're just looking at pictures
which is why people don't notice the $20
bill because they are actively focused
on something else as opposed to
passively focus
when these people realize they've had
$20 dangling in front of them some of
them have embarrassment some of them
just want the money and want to go back
to what they're doing other people were
literally almost annoyed because they
were disrupted by their texting emailing
social media for even $20 the more
individualized technology we have the
closer we are to becoming more cocooned
with ourselves technology can make you
really self-absorbed and only focus on
yourself in your technology cell phones
have done something really wonderful for
us and that they have trained us to
truly focus in on something but they've
also done a disservice to us because by
focusing in we lose out on what else is
going on
so real it broke my real
